modules.description: Calculates OCRA challenge-response values using a shared secret and a counter or time-based value. Processes binary and hexadecimal data formats for input and output. Enables secure authentication in systems requiring time or event-based one-time passwords.

Converts between string and internal representation of OCRA parameters, extracts data input specifications, and generates/verifies OCRA responses using cryptographic keys and challenge strings. Operates on custom types like `t`, `di`, `pinhash`, and `timestamp`, and handles cryptographic data via `Cstruct.t`. Used to validate one-time passwords in authentication protocols requiring counter, time, or session-based challenges.
